speaker: Outstanding Sound Mixing for a Comedy Series or Special
text: John Reiner, Andre Caporaso, Robert Douglass, Dana Mark McClure  * * *  ## Transcript {Iain McCallum}    _Act 1  Scene 1 -- Frasier's Apartment. Frasier is seeing a guest off the premises.  Both are dressed in tuxedos, as are Niles, Martin and Bulldog who are also in the room. Roz and Daphne are decked out in elegant eveningwear. _

speaker: Frasier
text: [_opening the front door as the guest walks out_] Glad you came back with us.  I hope you had a good time.  Well, I can't tell you how much fun this has been.  Listen, now that you know the way don't be a stranger.  OK.  Good night! [_closes the door after the man_] Who the hell was that?
prevSpeaker: Outstanding Sound Mixing for a Comedy Series or Special

speaker: Niles
text: He's not from the station?

speaker: Roz
text: I never saw him before.

speaker: Daphne
text: He was table-hopping like crazy during the awards.

speaker: Martin
text: That's �cause he was our waiter.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, that's the last time I say, "everybody back to my place!"

speaker: Bulldog
text: [_holding up his SeaBea_] Who cares about that guy?  This is a great night.

speaker: Roz
text: For you, maybe.  The rest of us lost.

speaker: Bulldog
text: Hey, it's not important whether you win or lose.  It's an honour just being nomin... [_breaks into laughter_] I couldn't get through that crap on stage, I can't get through it now!

speaker: Roz
text: Frasier, do you mind if I use your phone?

speaker: Frasier
text: No, not at all.  Who are you calling?  It's practically midnight.

speaker: Roz
text: Oh, I promised my grandmother I'd leave her a message telling her how we did. [_dials the number then starts speaking into the phone_] Hey Gammy, it's Roz.  Guess what?  We won again! We're all here celebrating. _Roz holds up the phone to indicate they make some kind of noise of celebration.  All they can muster is a half-hearted "YEAH!" sounding completely unconvincing._

speaker: Roz
text: Listen, I gotta go.  It's getting crazy here but I'll talk to you tomorrow.  Bye-bye.

speaker: Niles
text: You lied to "Gammy?"

speaker: Roz
text: Well, she's old and it makes her happy.  She smiled for a week when I won the Miss Seattle Pageant!

speaker: Frasier
text: You know, Roz raises a very interesting philosophical question...

speaker: Martin
text: [_preparing for the worst_] Oh, here we go.  Buckle up!

speaker: Frasier
text: Is it always morally wrong to lie?  We are taught that it is. Though obviously there are certain occasions when a lie would be acceptable.

speaker: Bulldog
text: Yeah, like the lies you tell a chick in bed.  "You're the best I've ever been with"; "Your thighs don't look that fat"; "Don't worry, I've had a vasectomy." [_Bulldog notes the disgusted faces around the room_] Hey, screw you guys!  I'm an artist; we live by different rules.

speaker: Niles
text: An argument can certainly be made that a lie is good when it spares someone unnecessary pain.  I'm reminded of Maris's brief flirtation with active wear when I assured her, "You look fine, darling.  Spandex is supposed to blouse!"

speaker: Frasier
text: You know, Lilith actually told me the other day that Frederick has taken to lying.  Yes, he told all of his friends that Lilith is an alien. [_laughs_]

speaker: Martin
text: Seems as good an explanation as any!

speaker: Frasier
text: He also told them that she wears her hair in a bun to hide the third eye in the back of her head. [_laughs again_]

speaker: Roz
text: How did Lilith find out?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, apparently she was driving him and Toby to a Junior Mensa meeting, she looked in the rearview mirror and saw that they were making faces at the other cars.  So, never have the words "_I_ can see you!" caused so much screaming and wetting of pants!

speaker: Daphne
text: I did my fair share of fibbing too.  I once told my school chums I was born with a tiny embryonic twin attached to my hip. [_Daphne laughs hilariously whilst the others look slightly perturbed_] Of course they were horrified and it didn't help my social life at all. [_sighs_] But for a while there it was nice having a sister. _Niles nods his head in sympathy before subtly removing the glass of champagne from Daphne's hand and passing it to Frasier who nods his head in agreement._

speaker: Niles
text: Oh.  Remember in prep school when we were so desperate to avoid The President's Physical Fitness Test...

speaker: Frasier
text: ...that we lit a match underneath the fire alarm and all the sprinklers went off.

speaker: Niles
text: And we blamed that delinquent kid, John Rajeski.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes.

speaker: Martin
text: [_appalled_] You did what?

speaker: Frasier
text: What's wrong?

speaker: Martin
text: You two swore up and down to me that you never set off that alarm.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_laughing_] Well, of course we weren't going to tell you.

speaker: Niles
text: For Heaven's sake, Dad, you can't be mad.  We were kids.

speaker: Martin
text: [_turning back_] You know, the headmaster said it was you two. I went down there and raised hell with him.  I said, "My kids don't lie."  Because of you that Rajeski kid got expelled!

speaker: Frasier
text: [_shocked_] Expelled?  If we'd have known that was going to happen we would have told the truth.

speaker: Niles
text: [_unrepentant_] Not me.  He was a brute and a meanie.

speaker: Frasier
text: You're right.  He used to make the most merciless fun of me, about how I always wore my gym shorts in the shower.  He used to call me "Shorts In The Shower Boy."  You don't have to be witty to be cruel.

speaker: Martin
text: Well, I don't give a damn what that kid did.  Getting him expelled was worse. [_angrily_] I'm going to bed.  Good night, everybody.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, I guess that brings an end to our little debate. Apparently there are no good lies.

speaker: Bulldog
text: Hey, hey, it's getting kinda heavy in here.  We gotta liven this place up, huh?  Hey, I know -- party games, huh?  All right Doc, I'm going to need a blindfold, whipped cream and a glass coffee table. [_everyone looks mystified_] What? Nobody went to camp?

speaker: Roz
text: [_getting up_] Forget it, Bulldog.  These guys are no fun. [_grabs his butt as she walks past_] You know what?  I know a great after-hours place where we can go get a few drinks.

speaker: Bulldog
text: [_rushing after Roz to the front door_] Now you're talking. Hey, if things go well I know an _after_ after-hours place. And I got the keys.

speaker: Roz
text: Mmm.  You get the elevator; I'll get my coat.

speaker: Bulldog
text: You're on. _Bulldog rushes out and Roz closes the door behind him, firmly locking it._

speaker: Roz
text: No good lies, my ass! _Daphne laughs and Frasier and Niles toast each other with their champagne.  FADE OUT  Scene 2 -- Cafe Nervosa. Niles walks in and sees Frasier sitting down.  Niles hangs up his coat before sitting down.  It is apparent that both brothers are wearing exactly the same suit right down to the shirt and tie. _

speaker: Niles
text: Good morning, Frasier.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, good morning, Niles... [_suddenly notices Niles's suit_] Oh dear God -- it's finally happened.  This is the thanks I get for introducing you to my personal shopper.  I gave her specific instructions to write down every article of clothing that I had purchased so we could avoid this sort of calamity!

speaker: Niles
text: I didn't use Renaldo.  This suit just caught my eye while I was shopping for shoes. _Niles and Frasier suddenly stop and stare tentatively at each other's shoes.  They both reel back in horror as they realise they've got the same as well._

speaker: Niles
text: [_annoyed_] Well, why didn't you also take my strong chin and swimmer's build?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh please.

speaker: Niles
text: Obviously we have to sit apart.

speaker: Frasier
text: Sit down!  There's something I need to talk to you about. I doubt most people are as tuned to these things as you and I are.  I'm sure they won't even notice.

speaker: Waitress
text: [_to Frasier_] Here you are, double espresso. [_to Niles_] I took a chance and brought you the same thing. [_leaves_]

speaker: Frasier
text: After our conversation last night I couldn't stop thinking about our getting John Rajeski expelled.  I didn't sleep a wink.

speaker: Niles
text: You can't be serious?

speaker: Frasier
text: You mean it didn't bother you?  Where is your conscience?

speaker: Niles
text: Perhaps it fell into the quad - along with my hall monitor beret when John hung me from the flagpole!  He was going to be expelled sooner or later.  You cannot guilt me into feeling bad.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, well, no one hated him more than I did but I still think we owe him an apology.  Can I borrow your phone, Niles?

speaker: Niles
text: Certainly. [_hands over phone then suddenly realises_] You're not going to call him?

speaker: Frasier
text: I am.

speaker: Niles
text: Are you insane?

speaker: Frasier
text: [_speaking into the phone_] A number for a John Rajeski, please? [_speaking to Niles_] Niles, my conscience won't rest until the two of us have said we're sorry. [_speaking into phone_] Oh yes, connect me please.

speaker: Niles
text: Leave me out of this.  I'm not sorry.  But don't tell him that.  And if he asks, I'm living in Italy.  No, no, France. No, Italy!

speaker: Frasier
text: [_speaking into the phone_] Yes, hello.  Is John Rajeski there, please?  It's an old friend... Oh, I'm terribly sorry to hear that.  Thank you. [_hangs up_] Niles, it's worse than we thought -- he's in prison.

speaker: Niles
text: [_smug_] Well... who's wearing shorts in the shower now?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, joke all you like.  I still can't help thinking this is all our fault.

speaker: Niles
text: How?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, he was always on the cusp.  Maybe he couldn't get into another prep school.  Maybe he had to go to public. Got in with the wrong crowd.  Couldn't hold on to a job. He could turn to a life of crime.

speaker: Niles
text: Frasier.  Sometimes bad things happen to bad people.  We did not set him on the path to prison.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, well until I'm sure of that fact my conscience will not rest.  I have got to speak with him. [_to waiter_] Can I have the check, please?

speaker: Niles
text: [_incredulous_] You're not going down to the jail?

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, I am.  I invite you to join me.

speaker: Niles
text: [_sarcastic_] Yes, that's a good idea, Frasier.  The Crane boys going to a prison in matching outfits! **DEAD MAN TALKING** _Scene 3 -- The prison. Frasier is nervously walking round a room bare except for a table and two chairs in the middle of the floor.  John Rajeski is brought in by a guard. _ [_N.B. John Rajeski is actually the name of one of the show's producer's assistants.  He appears as a Cafe Nervosa waiter in[[_3.24_], "You Can Go Home Again."_]

speaker: John
text: Frasier Crane?

speaker: Frasier
text: John.

speaker: John
text: [_smiling and shaking his hand_] Hey.  How's it going?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, fine.  And you?

speaker: John
text: Eh... [_shrugs and waves at his surroundings_] What brings you down here?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, I don't know if you get the alumni magazine, but I became a psychiatrist, and I'm currently conducting a study on men behind bars and how they got there... [_notices John's fists_] That's an awfully nasty bruise on your knuckles.

speaker: John
text: [_laughs_] I caught some guy using my comb.  I really hate it when people touch my stuff.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, yes.  I remember my brother Niles once sat in your chair in the cafeteria.  As I recall you put him on a tray and ran him through the dishwasher.

speaker: John
text: Yeah, class clown -- that was me. [_both laugh at this_] How is Niles, anyway?

speaker: Frasier
text: Ah, er... ah, he's abroad now.

speaker: John
text: Really?  Whoa, that must have hurt.

speaker: Frasier
text: No, no, I mean, er... yes, I suppose it did!  Well anyway, it would be an enormous help in my study if you could perhaps pinpoint the moment or event in your life that led you to here.

speaker: John
text: Ah, that's easy.  I'm doing time for passing a bad check.

speaker: Frasier
text: Ah. [_begins writing in his notebook_]

speaker: John
text: You see, I wanted to get my wife something nice.  We're going through a rough time recently.  I was scared she was going to leave me, you know?

speaker: Frasier
text: [_relieved_] Well, that was quick and painless.  We've identified the point where you fell off the beam. [_gets up to leave_]

speaker: John
text: Actually though, I was already on probation.  I did some time about ten years back for driving a car that didn't belong to me.

speaker: Frasier
text: And that was your first infraction?

speaker: John
text: Yeah.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_getting up again_] Well then, case closed, mystery solved. A young man yields to the lure of a bright and shiny car. Is there anything more tragic?

speaker: John
text: I did have a juvenile record.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_sitting down again_] Apparently there is.

speaker: John
text: I got in a high school fight.

speaker: Frasier
text: You did say high school, not prep school?

speaker: John
text: Oh, yeah, yeah, yeah.  This is way after you knew me.  I went bad then.  Always getting into fights.  Of course I wouldn't have been there in the first place if I hadn't have gotten thrown out of that good school me and you were in. That had a big effect on me you know?

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes well, perhaps we could continue our backward journey through...

speaker: John
text: [_getting up_] No, no, no.  That was a bum rap.  Somebody pulled the fire alarm and they blamed me for it.  They said I did it but I didn't do it.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_becoming visibly worried_] Let's discuss your early childhood.

speaker: John
text: [_stamping his fist off the desk in anger_] You know, the more I think about it, this all started the day I got thrown out of prep school.  Ever since then my life's been crap!  CRAP! [_now banging the desk in rage_]

speaker: Frasier
text: [_hurriedly gathering his notebook and getting up_] I think I have all the information I need now.

speaker: John
text: Sorry, I didn't mean to blow like that.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, that's all right, John. [_shaking hands with John_] Thank you for your time.

speaker: John
text: I got plenty of it.  I'll see you, huh?

speaker: Frasier
text: [_nervously thinking as John knocks on the door to leave_] No, no, John.  There's just one more thing. [_turns to the guard who's ready to take John back_] One second, please. [_turns to John_] There's something I need to tell you about, something that I did in school that I'm not very proud of... _At this point a very large, very burly fellow prisoner covered in bruises and a neck cast appears at the door._

speaker: Prisoner
text: Yo, John.  Sorry I touched your comb, man. _Needless to say Frasier looks frightened out of his wits as the prisoner scuttles off._

speaker: John
text: So what did you do?

speaker: Frasier
text: Er... well, I, er... I peeked over your shoulder once during an algebra quiz.

speaker: John
text: [_jokingly_] And I'm the one who gets expelled? _John is led away by the guard leaving Frasier wondering how he can break the news to John.  End of Act 1  Act 2  Scene 1 -- Frasier's Apartment.  Martin is sitting back in his chair. Daphne opens the front door to a limping, leaning Niles. _

speaker: Daphne
text: Evening, Dr. Crane

speaker: Niles
text: Hello, Daphne, Dad.

speaker: Daphne
text: Something wrong with your back?

speaker: Niles
text: I injured it this morning playing squash.  I had to make a dive to save match point.

speaker: Daphne
text: Well, I've got just the thing to take care of that.  You take off your jacket, I'll be right back. [_goes to the powder room_]

speaker: Niles
text: You're too kind.  You know, I should never even have attempted a move like that.  It was sort of a cross between a pirouette and a flying scissor kick.

speaker: Martin
text: You hurt yourself adjusting the seat in your Mercedes again, didn't you?

speaker: Niles
text: Quiet!

speaker: Daphne
text: All right, pull out your shirttails and lay facedown on the sofa.  I can guarantee you within a minute you'll be feeling much better. [_Niles lies down and mutters a moan of satisfaction_] I haven't even touched you yet!

speaker: Niles
text: I started without you.

speaker: Martin
text: [_concerned_] Hey, wait a minute.  You're not gonna use that stuff on him, are you?  She used it on me one time, it burned like hell!

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, hush up, old man.  It helped you, didn't it?

speaker: Martin
text: It nearly killed me!

speaker: Daphne
text: Listen to the big tough policeman.  You don't hear your son complaining, do we, Dr. Crane?

speaker: Niles
text: [_in heaven_] Not a bit!  Frost me like a cake!

speaker: Martin
text: Well, just wait a minute.  It goes on cool but it then it turns into a blowtorch.

speaker: Daphne
text: Well, I guess now we know who the real man in the family is, don't we?

speaker: Niles
text: I should say we d...[_winces slightly_] Ooh!

speaker: Daphne
text: Is it starting to warm up?

speaker: Niles
text: [_wincing a little more_] Ahh, yeah!  It's a... refreshing heat, like those towels they give you on the airplane. [_clearly feigning pleasure_] Whoooo!

speaker: Daphne
text: I'm not hurting you, am I?

speaker: Niles
text: No, no.  I'm just a little ticklish back there.

speaker: Martin
text: Well, I guess you are the tough one!

speaker: Daphne
text: [_getting up_] There you go.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, no, wait a minute, Daphne -- you missed a big spot right there.

speaker: Niles
text: [_hastily getting up_] No, that's OK!  Because it's all done now!  Thank you, Daphne! [_in agony_] A few minutes ago I was bent over in pain, [_rushes for the kitchen bounding over the coffee table_] but now look at me, I'm running! _Niles heads straight for the refrigerator, finds a bag of frozen peas and stuffs them down the back of his shirt, followed by the tub of ice cream.  He turns around and desperately rubs his back against the fridge.  Back in the living room Daphne is talking to Martin._

speaker: Daphne
text: How is that hip of yours, anyway?

speaker: Martin
text: Back off, witch woman!

speaker: Daphne
text: Evening, Dr. Crane.

speaker: Frasier
text: Evening, Daphne.

speaker: Martin
text: How did you get on at the jail?

speaker: Frasier
text: Horribly!  The man is convinced that getting thrown out of prep school was the beginning of his life of crime.

speaker: Martin
text: Been thinking that all these years?

speaker: Frasier
text: [_disconsolate_] No.  I sort of connected the dots for him!

speaker: Martin
text: You tell him it was you?

speaker: Frasier
text: I intended to, but I became convinced that the man would be willing to perform unspeakable atrocities on the responsible party or parties.

speaker: Martin
text: Well, you probably made the right call.  Knowing you, you'd beat yourself up worse than he would anyway.

speaker: Niles
text: [_emerging from the kitchen_] I hope you remembered to tell him I was an expatriate.

speaker: Frasier
text: I told him you were an ex-something. [_Niles looks confused._] You know, I just feel so guilty.  I have done this man a terrible injustice.

speaker: Daphne
text: You know, Dr. Crane, I've always believed life has a way of balancing itself out.  Yes, you may have treated this man unfairly, but think of all the people you've helped on your show.  Just yesterday you reconciled that couple on the brink of divorce and today you helped Molly from Tacoma overcome her addiction to Swedes.

speaker: Frasier
text: That was sweets, not Swedes!

speaker: Daphne
text: I thought it was strange when you told her to limit herself to one or two after meals.

speaker: Frasier
text: You know, perhaps I just have an overactive conscience. It's not enough that I help other people, I want to help this man.

speaker: Niles
text: Well, I hope you do, Frasier because then finally you'll stop torturing the rest of us with all your... [_bends over and suddenly cries out in agony_] Oh, pain's back!

speaker: Martin
text: Not to worry.  She's got more liniment.

speaker: Niles
text: [_suddenly standing upright still in agony_] Oh, pain's gone!

speaker: Daphne
text: Come on now.  Be brave. [_drags Niles's behind her_] Let's go into the loo and I'll give you a second coat. _Niles stretches out his hand in a last-ditch bid to stay out of Daphne's clutches but Martin just smiles at him as he is dragged into the powder room._

speaker: Frasier
text: You know, Dad, Daphne gave me a thought.  I'm a skilled couples' therapist.  John did mention that he was having marital problems...

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, Jeez!

speaker: Frasier
text: [_heading for the phone_] No, no, Dad.  This is perfect, this is perfect.  I may have ruined the last 25 years of this man's life but with my gift I could save the next 25. [_speaks into the phone_] Yes, a listing for a John Rajeski, please.

speaker: Martin
text: I'm telling you, Frasier, don't get mixed up with this guy. He's a felon.

speaker: Frasier
text: Dad, just relax, please -- I know what I'm doing. [_speaks into the phone_] Mrs. Rajeski?  Hello, you don't know me but I'm... _A piercing scream comes from the bathroom as the second coat is obviously being applied._

speaker: Frasier
text: Why - well, that's remarkable.  Yes, I am a friend of your husband's! _FADE TO:  Scene 2 -- Susan Rajeski's apartment.  Frasier knocks on the door and Susan opens. _

speaker: Frasier
text: Mrs. Rajeski?

speaker: Susan
text: Wow, it's really you -- Frasier Crane!

speaker: Frasier
text: May I?

speaker: Susan
text: Oh gosh, I'm sorry.  Please, please come in. [_Frasier walks in_] You know, you're kind of like a God at work. [_Frasier looks a bit humbled_] Please, please sit down.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_sitting down_] Thank you.  Let me cut right to the chase. John told me that you two were going through a bit of a rough patch and I was wondering if there was anything I could do to help?

speaker: Susan
text: Well, I love John.  I really do, but there is a problem. It's just a little difficult talking about it, you know?  I mean, it's a little embarrassing -- especially face-to-face.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, I'll tell you what.  Just pretend I'm on my radio show, [_turns his back to Susan_] and now you're just another caller.

speaker: Susan
text: OK.  Well, Dr. Crane, it's a sexual problem.

speaker: Frasier
text: Ah.

speaker: Susan
text: You see, I can only get really turned on when there's something that makes the whole situation sort of dangerous.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_turning round_] Dangerous?

speaker: Susan
text: You're looking at me.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_turning back round_] Sorry.

speaker: Susan
text: Like doing it in a car.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, that's not so dangerous.

speaker: Susan
text: You must be some driver.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_realises_] Oh.  And you've never had an accident?

speaker: Susan
text: No, I'm on the pill!

speaker: Frasier
text: [_back still turned_] So how long have you had this particular kink?

speaker: Susan
text: [_standing up starts playing with her buttons_] Well, I don't know really.  It kind of started around the time that I first met John.  I was working in a convenience store, I caught him shoplifting.  Next thing I knew we were rolling around on the Slurpy machine and I'd already pressed the silent alarm so I knew that the cops were on their way... _She rips off her dress to reveal a sexy black negligee.  Frasier is still sitting on the couch, back turned, unaware._

speaker: Susan
text: That's when I realised what really turns me on - knowing I could get caught at any moment. [_leaps onto Frasier's lap_]

speaker: Frasier
text: [_horrified_] Oh, Dear God!  He's out of jail, isn't he?

speaker: Susan
text: He could walk in at any time.

speaker: Frasier
text: He'll kill us!

speaker: Susan
text: [_writhing in pleasure_] Ooh, touch me here and say that.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_struggling up with Susan still attached_] ARE YOU CRAZY?! He doesn't even let people touch his comb!

speaker: Susan
text: I know.  What's that all about?

speaker: Frasier
text: [_backing off_] You might like to put your dress back on, straighten up before he gets home. _As Frasier heads for the front door there is a rattling on the other side.  John is home._

speaker: John
text: Open up.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_panicking_] You only have time for one -- I suggest the dress.  Where's the bedroom?

speaker: Susan
text: You're in it.

speaker: Frasier
text: Listen, you've got to get him out of here.

speaker: Susan
text: [_excited_] And pass the chance to have sex with him knowing he could find you here at any minute? _She heads for the front door with a huge grin on her face.  Meanwhile Frasier hides behind the sofa.  Susan opens the door to John._

speaker: Susan
text: [_hugging John_] Welcome home, baby!

speaker: John
text: [_hugging Susan then noticing the negligee_] What are you doing?

speaker: Susan
text: Well, I'm just getting ready for you.  Oh, I missed you.  So, do you want to?

speaker: John
text: Sure I do, but, er... you mean normally.  The super's not going to barge in?  You didn't dial 911 or anything like that?

speaker: Susan
text: I've got everything I need right here in this room.

speaker: John
text: [_kissing Susan_] I'm just going to pull down the shades. [_heads for the shades, which are next to the sofa_]

speaker: Susan
text: Wait, wait!

speaker: John
text: [_angrily_] What the hell is this?! _Susan looks caught, but he bends down and picks up a pair of high heels._

speaker: John
text: How much did you spend on these?

speaker: Susan
text: Oh, Johnny, can't we talk about that later?

speaker: John
text: [_hugging Susan_] Why don't you turn off the light? _Susan turns off the light.  Unfortunately the moonlight streams in through the open window, highlighting Frasier's silhouette hiding behind a paper screen, clearly visible behind John.  Susan hurriedly switches the lights back on._

speaker: Susan
text: It's too dark.  I want to see you.

speaker: John
text: Whatever you want, baby.  This is going to be great.  I am going to make love to you all night.

speaker: John
text: But first, I have a surprise for you.  I wrote a poem for you while I was in prison. [_takes out a piece of paper and begins reading_] "I am a garden, dry and brown.  You are the rain that tumbles down, Susan.  I am a beggar that needs to eat, you are a sandwich thick with meat, Susan." _By now Frasier has had enough and, revisiting his childhood, he holds a lighter up to the smoke alarm.  Needless to say this switches the sprinkler system on, practically drowning John and Susan._

speaker: John
text: Oh my God.  I knew you had something planned -- you set the building on fire!

speaker: Susan
text: No I didn't, I swear.

speaker: John
text: Come on, let's get out of here.

speaker: Susan
text: Oh, but the firemen -- they're on their way.

speaker: John
text: Come on! _John grabs Susan and drags her out of the now-soaked room.  A drenched Frasier emerges from his hiding place looking satisfied with himself.  He picks the poem up that has been left on the sofa, takes one look at it then discards it with a look of disgust. He checks the doorway before walking out.  End of Act 2_
